description: The Pacific archipelago has quarantined all airport employees who were on duty when a flight arrived with an infected passenger.
title: Tonga records its first Covid case.
title_page: Tonga Reports First Covid Case, Nearly 2 Years Into Pandemic - The New York Times
maintext:
For nearly two years, the remote Pacific nation of Tonga has avoided the global pandemic that has infected hundreds of millions of people and left millions dead.
That streak of good fortune ended on Friday, when the archipelago recorded its first coronavirus case.
The infected person arrived in Tonga on a commercial flight that left Christchurch, New Zealand, on Wednesday, the Ministry of Health in New Zealand confirmed in a statement. Christchurch has reported four active community cases in the last two days.
The ministry said the individual had been fully vaccinated, and had tested negative for the virus before travel. But a routine test after arrival, on Thursday, returned a positive result the following day. New Zealand health officials are working with Tonga to confirm the case.
